text:
As of Thursday morning, Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein has been accused of sexual harassment and assault by multiple women. Many folks in Hollywood have come out against his alleged actions, including A-listers such as Jennifer Lawrence, Lin-Manuel Miranda, Meryl Streep, and more. However, others are willing to either hold back judgment or outright defend him. Apparently, Lindsay Lohan falls in the latter camp.

In a recent Instagram story (that was deleted almost as quickly as it was posted), Lindsay recorded herself saying, "I feel very bad for Harvey Weinstein right now. I don't think it's right what's going on." In the video, she put an angel emoji under the name Harvey, a strange choice regardless of circumstance. Notably, the video was posted shortly after news broke that Weinstein's wife, Georgina Chapman, is leaving him, which Lindsay also commented on.

"I think Georgina needs to take a stand and be there for her husband," she said. "He's never harmed me or done anything wrong to me. We've done several movies together and so I think everyone needs to stop, I think it's wrong. So stand up."

Twitter was having none of Lindsay's defense of the former studio head, who has been accused of rape by at least three women, The New Yorker reported on October 10. That same day, the New York Times reported that Gwyneth Paltrow, Angelina Jolie, and other women alleged that Weinstein had sexually harassed them.

Through a spokesperson, Weinstein has denied the sexual assault allegations, as well as any allegations of sexual harrassment.
title: Lindsay Lohan Defends Harvey Weinstein, Says Georgina Chapman Should "Be There for Her Husband"
